content.RichText: {\rtf1\ansi {\fonttbl\f0\fnil Monospaced;\f1\fnil Dialog;\f2\fnil Arial;} {\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;\red51\green51\blue51;} \margl1417\margr1417\margt1417\margb1417\widowctrl \li0\ri0\fi0\sb120\f2\fs24\i0\b0\ul0\cf0 The Body Mass Index (BMI) is used to indicate whether someone has a healthy body weight. You probably remember the dietician measuring Morgan\rquote s bodyweight in \lquote Super Size Me\rquote . To calculate the BMI, you need to know the weight (in kilograms) and the height (in meters) of a person.\par 1. Use the formula below to calculate your BMI.\par \par \b BMI = weight / height 2\b0\par \par [where weight is measured in kg and height in meters]\par \par If you do not know how to use this formula, follow these steps:\par Take the height of your character in meters.\par Multiply this value by itself.\par Divide the weight of your character (in kg) by the outcome of the previous step.\par The outcome is the BMI.\par \par 2. Enter the BMI in your health passport.\par \par Now that you have calculated the BMI, you probably want to know what this value says about physical health. There are roughly four different categories:\par \par Underweight\tab\tab your BMI is under 18.5\par Normal weight\tab your BMI is in between 18.5 and 25\par Overweight\tab\tab your BMI is in between 25 and 30\par Obese\tab\tab your BMI is over 30\par \par Before jumping to conclusions, you should be aware that these categories normally apply to adults. Your body is still developing and growing, and your BMI might change considerably over the years.\par \li0\ri0\fi0\f1\ul0\cf1\par }
